alert.note: Alert for Attala; Choctaw; Leake; Neshoba; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Scott; Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 08 at 3:29PM CDT until July 09 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 111 expected. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 107. * WHERE...Choctaw, Oktibbeha, Attala, Winston, Noxubee, Leake, Neshoba and Scott Counties. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 9 AM to 8 PM CDT Saturday. For the Heat Advisory, until 9 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Attala; Choctaw; Leake; Neshoba; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Scott; Winston
